m_szDocSumamry: World/nation briefs WASHINGTON, D.C. Regulator: We 'pulled no punches' on Volt The U.S. government "pulled no punches" in investigating battery fires in the Volt, General Motors' electric car, said David Strickland, who heads the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. At a combative hearing, Republicans questioned whether the government's partial ownership in the automaker created a conflict of interest for the Obama administration in the probe, which began after a test car caught fire in June; the public was notified in November. Strickland said he would have gone public immediately
